intro: Eriolopha klossii, commonly known as the Kloss's leafroller, is a species of moth found in the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Gelechiidae and is characterized by its small size and intricate wing patterns. The larvae of this species feed on the leaves of various plants, including species of the genus Ficus. Its life cycle involves a complex series of larval stages, with the caterpillars often constructing protective leaf shelters. Due to its restricted habitat, Eriolopha klossii is considered a rare and understudied species in entomology.
